title: What are the best universities to study philosophy? - Quora

response.answer_text: Which country? For undergrad or graduate study? Which areas of specialisation? Some common answers: New York UniversityRutgersOxfordCambridgeNotre Dame Etc Brian Leiter, a professor of legal philosophy at Chicago maintains a resource called the Philosophical Gourmet Report (PGR), a resource that ranked universities for philosophy by various metrics. The PGR was controversial, and Leiter got a lot of flak for his role in it, but it would be a good place to start.  http://www.philosophicalgourmet.com But yeah, it depends quite a bit on which area of philosophy you're interested in. For philosophy of religion for example, the best are probably Notre Dame and Oxford. For history of political thought, Cambridge.
